sn3.8:1.2: Now at that time King Pasenadi of Kosala was upstairs in the royal longhouse together with Queen Mallikā.
sn3.8:1.3: Then the king said to the queen,
sn3.8:1.4: “Mallikā, is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”
sn3.8:1.6: But is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”
sn3.8:2.1: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala came downstairs from the stilt longhouse, went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
sn3.8:3.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha recited this verse:
sn3.8:4.1: “Having explored every quarter with the mind,
sn3.8:4.2: one finds no-one dearer than oneself.
sn3.8:4.3: Likewise for others, each holds themselves dear;
sn3.8:4.4: so one who loves themselves would harm no other.”
